hospital
quality

Healthcare pricing is opaque, confusing - and, therefore, ripe for visualization. My interactive visual below enables users to compare cost, quality, and size of roughly two-thousand medicare/medicaid hospitals. Filters enable the user to pick apart smaller trends, and explore cost/quality public datasets from the bottom-up.
A static form of this poster was displayed in the HIMSS healthcare conference, with an accompanying blog post here.

Optimized for Google Chrome / desktop devices. (Tutorial feature coming soon..)

data visualization / data science / d3.js / SQL / R

individual

2016

Percentile-rankings of hospital metrics shown (more info on label mouse-over). Each line represents one hospital (of 1800 total).

Use filter to constrain metrics, or slice according to relevant names, values, demographics.

High cost percentile indicates relatively high cost for procedures. High experience and outcome percentile indicate better quality of care.

Scroll down for process.
